name: First Year Seminar in Biomedical Sciences  Credit
description: Course Description: The university and its resources, college survival skills, careers in the biomedical sciences; current issues in health and biotechnology.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Concepts in Human Anatomy and Physiology  Credit
description: Course Description: Basic concepts in the anatomy and physiology of the human body.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Must have concurrent registration in BMS 300.

name: Biomedical Sciences
description: Course Description: Opportunities and challenges in biomedical sciences; business of science, ethics, model systems, cellular and systemic physiology.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  LIFE 102.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and recitation.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Honors–Physiological Concepts  Credit
description: Course Description: Honors breakout session integrating physiological concepts for students in BMS 260.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Must have concurrent registration in BMS 260.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Principles of Human Physiology
description: Course Description: Physiology of humans.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (BZ 101 or BZ 110 or LIFE 102) and (CHEM 103 or CHEM 107 or CHEM 111).
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Human Gross Anatomy
description: Course Description: Structure and function of the human body. Study of prosected human cadavers; clinical applications; living anatomy.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BZ 110 or LIFE 102.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture, laboratory,  and recitation.

name: Laboratory in Principles of Physiology
description: Course Description: Basic physiology lab exercises.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300, may be taken concurrently or BMS 360, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Credit not allowed for both BMS 302 and BMS 320.

name: Domestic Animal Gross Anatomy
description: Course Description: Comparative gross anatomy of domestic carnivores, ruminants, and horses.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BZ 110 or LIFE 102.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Credit not allowed for both BMS 305 and VS 333.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Anatomy for the Health Professions
description: Course Description: Gross anatomy of the human body from a regional perspective, utilizing clinical applications as a basis for anatomical understanding.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  LIFE 000 to 499 - at least 3 credits.
column11: Registration Information: Offered as an online course only.

name: Virtual Laboratory in Physiology
description: Course Description: Physiology lab exercises using a virtual laboratory simulation system.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300, may be taken concurrently or BMS 360, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both BMS 320 and BMS 302. Offered as an online course only.

name: Cellular Neurobiology
description: Course Description: Cellular and molecular bases of nervous system function and behavior.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Microscopic Anatomy
description: Course Description: Microscopic anatomy of mammalian tissue.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Credit not allowed for both BMS 330 and VS 331.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Functional Neuroanatomy
description: Course Description: Functional systems and circuits of the human brain and spinal cord.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory.

name: Fundamentals of Physiology
description: Course Description: Cell, tissue, and organ function related to integrated whole body function.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (BZ 110 or LIFE 102) and (CHEM 245, may be taken concurrently or CHEM 341, may be taken concurrently).Term Offered: Spring.

name: Supervised College Teaching
description: Course Description: Supervision by and work with graduate teaching assistants in small group learning sessions involving students enrolled in BMS 300.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.
column11: Registration Information: A maximum of 10 combined credits for all 384 and 484 courses are counted towards graduation requirements.

name: Neuroanatomy Through Clinical Case Studies  Credit
description: Course Description: Neuroanatomical case studies to reinforce and apply information gained in BMS 345, Functional Neuroanatomy.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 345, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: Biomedical sciences majors only. Required field trips.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Laboratory Research in Biomedical Sciences
description: Course Description: Hands-on experience in laboratory research methods for students working individually on a project which stems from a larger research project of a faculty member's laboratory.  All students will work in the same facility equipped with appropriate equipment and supplies to conduct the student research proposal.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for laboratory and recitation.

name: Nerve and Muscle-Toxins, Trauma and Disease
description: Course Description: Structure, composition, function of nerves and muscles, etiology of genetic and autoimmune neuromuscular diseases, alteration by toxins and nerve gas.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 325 or BMS 345.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Human and Animal Reproductive Biology
description: Course Description: Basis for male and female reproductive function in humans and animals.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Cardiopulmonary Physiology
description: Course Description: Normal and pathophysiology of cardiovascular and pulmonary systems.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Perspectives in Cardiopulmonary Diseases
description: Course Description: Pathophysiology of cardiopulmonary diseases.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 420, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and recitation. Biomedical sciences majors only.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Introduction to Systems Neurobiology
description: Course Description: Functional organization of the nervous system at the circuit level in producing simple and complex behaviors, sensations and cognition.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 325.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Endocrinology
description: Course Description: Physiology of the glands of internal secretion.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Pharmacology
description: Course Description: Pharmacologic principles, absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion, side effects, and actions of drugs.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (BMS 300 or BMS 360) and (BC 351 or LIFE 210).Term Offered: Spring.

name: Essentials of Pathophysiology
description: Course Description: Integration of different facets of mechanisms underlying health and disease.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.
column11: Registration Information: Biomedical sciences majors only.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Pathophysiology Perspectives
description: Course Description: Capstone course in pathophysiology for biomedical sciences majors.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 460, may be taken concurrently.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Internship
description: Course Description: Work/research experience with an approved preceptor outside of a university laboratory.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of department required.

name: Independent Study
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.

name: A  Honors: Human Gross Anatomy
description: Course Description: Honors breakout session for students in Human Gross Anatomy.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 301, may be taken concurrently.

name: B  Honors: Physiology Lab
description: Course Description: Honors breakout session for students in Physiology Lab.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 302, may be taken concurrently.

name: C  Honors: Physiology Case Studies
description: Course Description: Honors breakout session for students in Physiology Case Studies.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 360, may be taken concurrently.

name: D  Honors: Animal Gross Anatomy
description: Course Description: Honors breakout session for students in Animal Gross Anatomy.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 305, may be taken concurrently.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Research
description: Course Description: Faculty-directed research in biomedical sciences.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.

name: Mammalian Physiology I
description: Course Description: Cell physiology of nerve, skeletal, cardiac and smooth muscle with an emphasis on how cellular functions integrate into systems behavior.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.
column11: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both BMS 500 and NB 501. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Mammalian Physiology II
description: Course Description: Respiratory, renal, digestive, endocrine, metabolic, and reproductive function.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Readings in Cellular Neurobiology  Credit
description: Course Description: Faculty directed exploration of key literature in the neurosciences.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (BZ 100 to 481 - at least 1 course or BIO 100 to 481 - at least 1 course or LIFE 100 to 481 - at least 1 course) and (BC 100 to 481 - at least 1 course and PH 100 to 481 - at least 1 course) and (MATH 141 or MATH 155 or MATH 160 to 161 - at least 1 course or MATH 255 or MATH 261) and (BMS 325) and (BMS 500, may be taken concurrently or NB 501, may be taken concurrently). Restriction: Must not be a: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior.
column11: Also Offered As:  NB 500.
column12: Registration Information: Senior standing. Written consent of instructor. Credit not allowed for both BMS 502 and NB 500.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Developmental Neurobiology
description: Course Description: Molecular mechanisms involved in development of nervous system including differentiation, growth, pathfinding, and synaptogenesis.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (BIO 100 to 481 or BZ 100 to 481 or LIFE 100 to 481) and (BC 100 to 481 and PH 100 to 481) and (MATH 141 or MATH 155 or MATH 160 to 161 or MATH 255 or MATH 261).
column11: Also Offered As:  NB 503.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both BMS 503 and NB 503.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Neuronal Circuits, Systems and Behavior
description: Course Description: Anatomical and physiological organization of the nervous system.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 325 or BMS 500 or NB 501.
column11: Also Offered As:  NB 505.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both BMS 505 or NB 505.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Comparative Reproductive Physiology
description: Course Description: A comparative overview of reproduction in vertebrates (focusing on mammals) emphasizing both conserved and species-specific aspects of physiology.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Domestic Animal Dissection
description: Course Description: Dissection of domestic animals.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 305.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Assisted Reproductive Technologies Lab I
description: Course Description: Principles and fundamental skills of assisted reproduction technologies, including sterile methods for collecting and culturing oocytes, in vitro fertilization and embryo culture.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Admission to the Master of Science in Biomedical Sciences, Plan B, Reproductive Technology Specialization. Must register for lecture and laboratory. Credit not allowed for both BMS 540 and BMS 580A2.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Assisted Reproductive Technologies Lab II
description: Course Description: Principles and fundamental skills needed for assisted reproductive technologies, including advanced techniques for splitting, obtaining biopsies from and transferring embryos; as well as learning the latest industry techniques for collecting, staining, manipulating and labeling embryos.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 540. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Admission to the Master of Science in Biomedical Sciences, Plan B, Reproductive Technology Specialization. Must register for lecture and laboratory. Credit not allowed for both BMS 541 and BMS 580A3.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Neuroanatomy
description: Course Description: Nervous system structure and function presented from a systems perspective; applied and comparative aspects are emphasized.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor required. Must register for lecture and laboratory.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Human Anatomy Dissection
description: Course Description: Regional approach to human gross anatomy through laboratory dissection of human cadaver.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.Term Offered: Fall.

name: A  Managing a Career in Science
description: Course Description: Survival skills for professionals.  How to succeed in science, including writing, teaching, speaking; finding the right job.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall.

name: B  Managing a Career in Research
credits: Survival Skills for Research (M.S. and Ph.D.)  Credit
description: Course Description: Survival skills for professionals.  How to succeed in science, including improving writing, teaching, speaking; finding the right job.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Advanced Human Gross Anatomy
description: Course Description: Clinical application of human anatomy through case-based study.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Mechanisms of Hormone Action
description: Course Description: Synthesis, secretion, and mechanisms of action of hormones.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 430 or BMS 501. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall (odd years).

name: Metabolic Endocrinology
description: Course Description: Endocrine regulation of metabolic homeostasis; effects of exercise or pregnancy.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 631. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall (odd years).

name: Domestic Animal Anatomy-Case Discussions
description: Course Description: Clinical case discussions utilized in advanced understanding of domestic animal anatomy and physiology.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Must have concurrent registration in BMS 531.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Reproductive Physiology and Endocrinology
description: Course Description: Reproductive physiology and endocrinology of vertebrate animals.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 501. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall (even years).

name: Research Techniques for Gametes and Embryos  Credit
description: Course Description: Collection, storage, evaluation, in vitro manipulation, and replacement of sperm, oocytes, embryos, and other reproductive tissues.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Admission to Biomedical Sciences graduate program required.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Applied Andrology
description: Course Description: The male side of reproduction including the development of the male reproductive tract, hormonal control of the tract and spermatogenesis, fundamentals of spermatogenesis and seminal plasma and the physiology of sperm. Current methods for collecting, analyzing, cryopreserving and preparing sperm for either artificial insemination or in vitro fertilization.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BMS 300 or BMS 360 or BMS 409. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Credit not allowed for both BMS 643 and BMS 680A2.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Supervised College Teaching
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.

name: Seminar-Classics in Neurosciences  Credit
description: Course Description: Review of classic papers in the neurosciences.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Admission to Biomedical Sciences graduate program required.

prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
